long_desc.thetext:
I have noticed that many times, both in the manual and the blog reports, the word "when" is used instead of "if". This is obviously the result of a mistranslation of the German word wenn, which is used for both.
Examples: [1] http://news.qooxdoo.org/qooxdoo-re-shaped <- The first sentence should either be "If you are reading this, ..." or "By the time you are reading this..." etc..
[2] http://manual.qooxdoo.org/devel/pages/mobile/tutorial.html <- "The usage of the form classes should be familiar to you when you have used the RIA widget set.", Should be something like "The usage of the form classes should be familiar to you IF you have used the RIA widget set BEFORE/PREVIOUSLY."
I can't locate yet further examples, but I thought simply to raise attention to the matter.
Thanks for the great work! Omri

Hi Omri, good point, thanks for raising this. [2] is truely a mistake. In the case of [1] the intented meaning is in fact temporal, but I agree that "By the time you are reading this..." is indeed the better formulation.

Fixed [2] (I think [1] is good enough).

Hi Omri, thanks for your input. Lets keep fixing all those language glitches, no matter how minor - they distract, at least.
I'd like to encourage you (and everybody else) to consider to use pull requests on Github. That'd be convenient for proposing even a larger number of documentation fixes. The qooxdoo Manual is under https://github.com/qooxdoo/qooxdoo/tree/master/documentation/manual/source/pages
